intro: Arrabidaea decora, commonly known as the purple coneflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy petals. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its striking purple to pink flowers bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to naturalize in suitable habitats.
